Employee: Former  Server  in Pace, Florida
Description: [" The best benefit with working with Chili's is the flexible hours, corporate environment and having fun. This is a fun, face-paced restaurant and they genuinely care about your success within the company."]

Employee: Former  Quality Assurance Analyst  in Culpeper, Virginia
Description: [' Great discounts on food and team work was amazing.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Stevens Point, Wisconsin
Description: [' No 401K, no dental or vision, get a bonus at 5, 10, 15 year. Getting time off can be a pain']

Employee: Former  Front End Staff  in Sandy, Utah
Description: [" There's benefits? Oh wait, you have to be full-time to get benefits. From reading through the package, it is obvious the only reason there are even benefits is because Chili's is being forced by the law, so that's pretty awesome that the government is making sure Chili's realizes human beings exist."]

Employee: Current  Employee  in Orlando, Florida
Description: [' there were no benefits offered to part time employees when i was present at the company']

Employee: Current  Expo  in Baltimore, Maryland
Description: [' They offer benefits but I didn’t use them.']

Employee: Current  Manager  in Indianapolis, Indiana
Description: [' We have no sick days']

Employee: Former  Server/Bartender  in Holmdel, New Jersey
Description: [" There isn't much although aflec does come in to provide health insurance."]

Employee: Former  cook  in Virginia Beach, Virginia
Description: [" didn't have the benefits package. told it was expensive and not the best package."]

Employee: Former  server  in Pryor, Oklahoma
Description: [" I was part time, I didn't get any benefits. I don't know what they offer the full time employees"]

Employee: Current  Employee  in New Orleans, Louisiana
Description: [' Training is good. It’s five days of shadowing someone else for 3-4 hours. Between the third and fourth day, depending on your floor manager, they will be expecting you to greeting guest and leading your trainer a few times. You should be able to handle a table on your own by the third day. The last day of training you have to get verified by the floor manager which is just serving them. I’ve never been a server so for me, the hardest part is learning the table numbers. Overall, I really like Chili’s plus you get 50% off on certain meals and after 90 days, you get a card that will allow you to get discounts at any location.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Tomball, Texas
Description: [" Chili's only offers benefits to full time employees. I am only part-time, so I do not really know anything about their benefit packages."]

Employee: Current  Employee  in Tomball, Texas
Description: [" Chili's offers benefits to full-time workers only. I am part-time, so I do not know anything really about their benefit packages."]

Employee: Former  Food server  in Sulphur Springs, Texas
Description: [' Good benefits for an eating establishment']

Employee: Current  Dishwasher  in Carson, California
Description: [" They have A LOT of benefits such as 401k, very flexible scheduling, awsome staff, and many opportunities to move up in positions. However it is a fast working place and the pay is low. But if money isn't the most important thing to you and love working hard then this is the place for you."]

Employee: Current  Server  in Little Rock, Arkansas
Description: [" the staff is very welcoming and they always make you feel like you're right at home. They also are very informational"]

Employee: Current  Server/Waiter  in Ogden, Utah
Description: [' If you get over 30 hours of work per week on average then you qualify for insurance, 401k matching, and more. They have a program for for helping an occasional employee with financial aid in extremely hard situations.']

Employee: Former  Line Cook  in Bullhead City, Arizona
Description: [' I like the good things about working there i hear you get discounts on some things in certain places']

Employee: Current  General Manager  in Chicago, Illinois

Employee: Former  Line Cook  in Arapahoe, Colorado
Description: [' There was no paid time off']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Waukesha, Wisconsin
Description: [' Time off to get is easy if you are responsible enough to ask off in time. But if you try and let them know last minute it can be hard to get off.']

Employee: Former  server  in Greensboro, North Carolina
Description: [' you can make very good money especially in the weekend and holiday']

Employee: Current  Server  in Huntsville, Alabama

Description: [' They put money in your 401k medical dental and vision are affordable. Blue cross is taken everywhere. Vision is harder to locate dr that will take insurance.']

Employee: Former  Line Cook  in Las Vegas, Nevada

Employee: Former  Employee  in Branson, Missouri

Employee: Former  Employee  in Grand Prairie, Texas
Description: [' The insurance I had had a high deductible']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Orlando, Florida

Employee: Former  Host  in Las Vegas, Nevada

Employee: Former  Employee  in Kerrville, Texas
Description: [' Company perks, phone bill discount,']

Employee: Former  Assistant Manager  in Tucson, Arizona
Description: [' I really enjoyed the fact that this company is attempting to reach a new market in the millenials and that focus is changing the way they manager and structure their company vision.']

Employee: Former  Line Cook  in Lake Mary, Florida
Description: [' Was not impressed with the benefits its as average as it gets compared to most chain restaurants you see.']

Description: [" The health insurance was difficult to pay because being paid with tips, never had a paycheck. So they finally createda direct deposit for it, but I was dropped 2 years in a row for not knowing I didn't get enough money to cover it."]

Employee: Current  Food Server  in Houston, Texas
Description: [" The benefits package is only offered for employee's who are full-time."]

Employee: Current  Server  in Appleton, Wisconsin

Employee: Former  Grill   in Little Rock, Arkansas
Description: [' Company have good benefits for long term employs']

Description: [' practically non existent at the bartender/server level. They could certainly have a better benefit package!']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Milwaukee, Wisconsin

Employee: Former  Server/Bartender  in Bastrop, Texas
Description: [" Benefits aren't great, insurance isn't the best."]

Employee: Former  Hostess  in Fort Worth, Texas
Description: [' The only benefit is a 50% employee discount.']

Employee: Current  Food Server  in Orlando, Florida
Description: [" They offer good benefits to everyone!!! I only wish I could have an HSA and stock options as a team member. They have great benefits. Even the starting out benefits as a part time server, was more than what I had at my previous job as a manager. I am very satisfied with the Benefits it's a huge plus for employment happiness."]

Employee: Current  Server/Bartender  in Reno, Nevada
Description: [' 50% of meals, 401k plan available after 1yr employment and maintains 30+ hrs a week, part time benefits available when signed up within 30 days of hire date. Receive tips daily. Discounts for cell phone providers, office supplies, and ford motor company']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Austin, Texas
Description: [' 401K, paid vacation, tuition reimbursement']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Detroit, Michigan
Description: [' Benefits package has a massive deductible. Awful copay. Only worthwhile at a management level']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Streamwood, Illinois
Description: [' paid vacation for full time, tuition assistance, terrible food discount if your not working, no payed breaks decent discount on food if working']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Garland, Texas
Description: [' Benefits are far from great. Know of multiple managers that use their spouses job insurance instead of what chilies offers.']

Employee: Current  Server  in Newport News, Virginia
Description: [' 401K available after 1 year of service']

Employee: Former  Bartender/Server  in Casa Grande, Arizona
Description: [' The health insurance they provide is horrible and a lot more expensive than it should be. They do match up to 5% of your 401k plan.']

Employee: Current  Host/Hostess  in Lafayette, Louisiana
Description: [" Best thing about working here is after 3 months you get a credit card looking compensation card or comp card. It gives you 50% off at chili's and its sister companies or up to 4 people it goes down the more people you have. You get a bonus for every year ou work if you work an average of 40 hours a week, but maybe 3 people in the whole front of house get that"]

Employee: Former  A raggedy hostess  in Arlington, Texas
Description: [' Everything at Chilis was bad. The only good thing, was sabotaging the chefs and using them for free food every single night.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Tyler, Texas
Description: [' overall its all very good with the whole package. their really is no downsides, i felt happy to just have the medical and dental benefits.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Tempe, Arizona
Description: [' Employee card after 3 months of working that gets you half off anything. Before 3 months only certain items are half off.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Mesa, Arizona
Description: [' Health benefits for part-time employees at a reasonable rate']

Employee: Former  General Manager  in Waipahu, Hawaii
Description: [" The Health insurance sucked, unless you became seriously ill - Everything else depended on if you worked for Franchise or Brinker - Brinker did a much better job of taking care of it's team, over the Franchise owners - some franchise owners were not good at living up to their commitments to their team - either on a timely basis, or on a growth basis."]

Employee: Current  Server/Bartender  in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania
Description: [' Company perks are great, they are available to any employee who is willing to put in the time and effort to deserve them.']

Employee: Current  Server/Bartender  in Edmond, Oklahoma
Description: [" 401K, Insurance (including eye and dental) are all available at full time (30 hrs/wk) with partial benefits available at part time (including insurance) . Yearly bonus for full time employees on anniversary regardless of position worked. 50% Discount at all chili's locations"]

Employee: Current  Server  in San Antonio, Texas
Description: [' I am not full time but if I request a day or so off I normally get it.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Dallas, Texas
Description: [" Meh. Health benefits pretty pricey. Preventative work is great but if you have anything serious... well just hope that doesn't happen because based on the two coverages available you're either screwed or totally screwed."]

Employee: Current  Food Server  in Shawnee, Oklahoma
Description: [" Chilis mangers (I don't know about the ceos) only care about labor and have the lowest paid employees work the hardest. Chilis does an anniversary reward where you get a check for working for chilis. More than half the check is taxed so you end up with less than 30.00. Most of the time mangers will make it a point to keep your hours under 40 hours so you can't collect certain benifits."]

Employee: Former  Manager  in Gilroy, California
Description: [' Good Dental and health benefits.']

Employee: Current  Manager  in Dallas, Texas
Description: [' Lots of coverage, plus additional things for well being.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Carefree, Arizona
Description: [" Gret coverage for part-time and full-time employees that won't break your piggy bank!"]

Employee: Current  HoH   in Beckley, West Virginia
Description: [" Chili's DOES NOT offer hourly full time employees PAID VACATIONS. Instead you're given a $250 yearly bonus (about $160 after taxes). Pathetic."]

Employee: Former  Employee  in Mountain View, California
Description: [' its a restaurant the regular employees are not offered benefits besides discounts.']

Employee: Current  Managing Partner  in Nashville, Tennessee
Description: [' Best thing is they have a great 401k match. Discounts are great and are more than just food. Worst thing is insurance either has a very high deductible or is very expensive per month in premium if you it lowered.']

Description: [' You have the option to get health insurance through them which is a good price. You get free food if you are a cook.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Los Angeles, California
Description: [' Not great - just the bare minimum to get you to sign up.']

Employee: Current  Server/Bartender  in Providence, Rhode Island

Employee: Current  Lead Bartender  in Tulsa, Oklahoma

Employee: Former  Line Cook  in Williston, Vermont
Description: [' No benefits other than job training which is more of a joke than anything.']

Employee: Former  Assistant Restaurant Manager  in Milpitas, California

Employee: Current  Employee  in South Elgin, Illinois

Employee: Former  Employee  in Aurora, Illinois
Description: [' Costs keep rising and they keep cutting benefits. Otherwise a pretty standard package.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Wilmington, North Carolina
Description: [" Great team member discount for food. Any time you are not working you can get 50% off for up to a party of 4 at any corporate Chili's. This includes everything but alcohol and can be used in to go or at Maggiano's. You get the benefit card after 90 days on the job."]

Employee: Current  General Manager  in Mount Pleasant, Texas
Description: [' Bonus package is very lucrative based on results.']

Employee: Current  manager  in Asheville, North Carolina

Employee: Former  Expo  in Clarksville, Tennessee

Employee: Current  Employee  in Centennial, Colorado
Description: [" The best thing is that they offer a 50% discount for any restaurant owned by Brinker. Their plan is very limited and does not include health insurance that would allow for low premiums"]

Employee: Former  Server/Bartender  in Raleigh, North Carolina
Description: [' They do not really offer any benefits unless you are a full time employee. They will try to limit this so they dont have too many people on the plan.']

Employee: Former  Food Server  in Jacinto City, Texas
Description: [' They have health insurance and 401k but never signed up because did not have money to pay while I was working .']

Employee: Current  dishwasher   in Dothan, Alabama
Description: [' Great benefit all the perks to a good job']

Employee: Former  Server/Bartender  in Chicago, Illinois
Description: [" There was tuition reimbursement for students, it wasn't that much, but it was a nice little check. I didn't get the insurance, I don't remember it being that good. There were employees that had it and they used to complain that they still owed after it was taken out of their check."]

Employee: Former  Lead Bartender  in Long Beach, California
Description: [" Chili's provides an excellent benefits package. Medical and dental insurance are available for full time employees."]

Employee: Former  Server/Bartender  in Jacksonville, Florida
Description: [' Health insurance available for employees and their families.']

Employee: Former  Manager  in Houston, Texas
Description: [' They have 401k. Insurance is standard and about $378 bi-weekly for family. 2 week paid vacation after a year.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in San Jose, California
Description: [' The perks and the flexible schedule']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Fredericksburg, Virginia
Description: [' I am part-time so do not receive these benefits']

Employee: Former  Line Cook  in Largo, Florida
Description: [" Health insurance isn't great. An average benefits package for this type job, maybe slightly better than average"]

Employee: Former  Server  in Wayne, Pennsylvania
Description: [' 50% discount on employee shift meals (I believe managers receive free meals as well), not including alcoholic beverages. Their healthcare package appeared to be pretty competitive from what I read after being offered to enroll (the location I worked at was run by Quality Dining, not Brinker). I believe healthcare is only offered to full-time employees (30+ hours weekly), but the rates are definitely much lower than those offered in the open marketplace.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Irvine, California
Description: [' BEST - uses hot schedules, really easy to figure out schedule - great insurance especially for students WORST - unsure at the moment']

Employee: Former  Restaurant Manager  in Thornton, Colorado
Description: [' Good insurance. 401k match up to 4%. No sick days. Two weeks vacation until five years of employment']

Employee: Current  Host/Hostess  in McKinney, Texas
Description: [' Chilis has WONDERFUL benefits, really good health insurance, dental and everything. Im not familar with everything on the 401k because when I started working I was only 18 and im under my parents plan. But discounts wise you have a membership card where you get 50% off up to 4 people and the more people you add the higher the discount, but its a great deal. Also we have this program for when a ChiliHead is having personal problems like a house fire or something where we give them money. you can give it up front or you can have them take the money out of your check monthly. You also get discounts from many stores and business like certain car shops and payless.']

Employee: Current  Food Server  in Jacksonville, Texas
Description: [" I did not accept a benefits/insurance package. However, there are several discounts available to employees (not just at Chili's and other Brinker restaurants)"]

Employee: Former  Hostess  in Weston, Florida
Description: [' The benefits package is very costly']

Employee: Former  Restaurant Manager  in Atlanta, Georgia
Description: [" The medical stinks, the bonuses are ok. The company says the care about quality of life but doesn't translate into real life."]

Employee: Former  Employee  in Hartford, Connecticut
Description: [' The health plan deteriorated over the years cutting benefits and raising prices']

Employee: Current  Server/Bartender  in Danbury, Connecticut
Description: [' No benefits being a part-time employee']

Description: [" Didn't stay long enough to get benefits"]

Description: [' takes a year, but atleast it is one, they give you like 50% off if you dine with 2, 33% for 3 people, and 25% for 4 people which is kinda nice. also they do health insurance but its some doodoo,']

Employee: Current  Togo specialist   in Dallas, Texas

Description: [' Having to wait 90 days before recieving discount card.']

Employee: Former  Server  in San Diego, California
Description: [" There are no benefits for part-time people until you work there for a year, then they offer bad part-time health benefits, but that's it. You get 50% off your meal when you come in on your day off, but that does not count for alcohol, desserts, or tips. So...very few."]

Employee: Current  Culinary Manager  in Louisville, Kentucky
Description: [' Worst was the wait for coverage. Best is the ongoing match of the 401k.']

Employee: Current  food expo  in Capitola, California
Description: [' Benefits are not bad if you are just starting off and its your first job. 50% off food was probably the best part of the benefits package. Employee: Former  Employee  in Fort Worth, Texas
Description: [' Employees receive 50% off meals']

Employee: Current  Restaurant Manager  in Dallas, Texas
Description: [" Free food at any Chili's is cool. Insurance is OK but prices go up significantly every year. 401k is descent. They match up to 4% but could offer something for long term employees. Vacation is fair but wish we could sell vacation time prior to 10 years. Two days off a week is nice but could be more flexible with weekends."]
